ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: New grammars, vocabularies, as well as knowledge about Japanese culture.
I really felt like I improved every aspect of my Japanese language ability: reading, writing, speaking, and listening.
I learned how to speak, read, and write Japanese.
I developed N2 Japanese proficiency skills in this course.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: The course is well organized and designed and we get a lot of opportunities to practice oral speaking, which is very practical and useful.

I think the course is very well-designed to help students improve every aspect of their language abilities. I did feel like I was less motivated and engaged to the class compared to L1, but it's probably not fair to say that this was a fault of the class.
I think the course is run very well as it is, providing a challenging (albeit doable) experience that maximizes learning.
THE TEACHER (MARI STEVER) IS VERY NICE AND HELPFUL, VERY RESPONSIVE TO ANY QUESTIONS/ERRORS IN CLASS

I think that my low engagement in the course had less to do with the course than with the fact that I was generally overworked. I think the class could be made stronger if there was a more gradual and instituted way of learning vocabulary. I think because we were given 70 some vocab words and then expected to learn them  rather than, say, 10 vocab words a day  it made it more difficult to learn and practice.

The course is very good in giving us speaking practice, although it's difficult to get the full value of that practice without being prepared before class. One weakness of the course might be that there was not a lot of vocabulary or grammar quizzes to push us to always be fully prepared before class.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: 100% yes. I loved everything about this class and am super glad I chose to continue learning Japanese with Stever-sensei. However, I'd say that the more a student is engaged with and committed to learning the language, the more they'll learn and enjoy. For someone who doesn't want to put in the work, the rewards of class will probably be disappointing.
If you're interested in learning Japanese, I think it's one of the best language programs at the university!
YES FOR ANYONE WHO WANTS TO LEARN MORE JAPANESE

Im not sure. I think that yes  probably it is a good class, and if you study well, then you will learn a lot. Im not actually sure how much I learned because I felt like I spent so much time catching up with vocabulary and grammar that I would forget from previous units.
Yes, this course is great at improving your Japanese.
Yes, as the instructor I had is very interactive and clearly enjoys teaching Japanese.
